message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.HC 

Reasoning: 
- cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is the most likely category as the paper focuses on building personalized bridges between users and little-known content using Twitter profiles and networks. 
- cs.SOC (Social and Behavioral Sciences) is also likely as the paper explores the effect of multi-faceted use of Twitter on the perception of the bridges and conducts a user study and in-depth interviews to evaluate the efficacy of the proposed approach. 
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is another possible category as the paper involves matching a user's interest model to a library of knowledge about the countries. 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language) is a potential category as the paper mentions the importance of proper selection of language in building good bridges. 
- cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) is also a possible category as the paper evaluates the user perception of the bridges and gathers qualitative insight into the effect of multi-faceted use of Twitter.
